desc_content.paragraph: Bases: AppConfig
Application Configuration for User Authentication.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.user_authn.cookies module
section.paragraph: Utility functions for setting logged in cookies used by subdomains.

desc_content.paragraph: Check whether the request has logged in cookies set.
Delete cookies indicating that the user is logged in (except for session cookie.) :param response: The response sent to the client. :type response: HttpResponse
Generates the response and resets the JWT related cookies in the response for the given user.
Set cookies at the time of user login. See ALL_LOGGED_IN_COOKIE_NAMES to see which cookies are set.

list_item.paragraph: request (HttpRequest) The request to the view, used to calculate the cookies expiration date based on the session expiration date.
response (HttpResponse) The response on which the cookie will be set.
user (User) The currently logged in user.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the common cookie settings (e.g. expiration time).
Bases: Exception
This is a helper for the login view, allowing the various sub-methods to error out with an appropriate failure message.
Returns a dict representation of the error.
Bases: Exception
This is a helper for the login view, allowing the view to error out if password is vulnerable.

section.paragraph: ACE message types for user_authn-related emails.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: BaseMessageType
A message to the user with password reset link.

Update a collection of user profile fields in segment when they change in the database

list_item.paragraph: user The user object for the user being changed
table The name of the table being updated
changed_fields A mapping from changed field name to old and new values.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.user_authn.tasks module
section.paragraph: This file contains celery tasks for sending email

desc_content.paragraph: Checks if auto-generated username should be enabled.
Checks if login/registration should be done via MFE.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.user_authn.urls_common module
section.paragraph: Note: The split between urls.py and urls_common.py is hopefully temporary. For now, this is needed because of difference in CMS and LMS that have not yet been cleaned up.
This is also home to urls for endpoints that have been consolidated from other djangoapps, which leads to inconsistent prefixing.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.user_authn.utils module
section.paragraph: Utility functions used during user authentication.

desc_content.paragraph: Check the Pwned Databases for vulnerable passwords. check_pwned_password returns password hash suffix and a dictionary containing suffix of every SHA-1 password hash beginning with the specified prefix, followed by a count of how many times it appears in their data set.
Generate 3 available username suggestions based on the provided name.

field_body.paragraph: name (str) The full name to generate username suggestions from. Must contain only ASCII characters.

definition_list_item.term: A list of up to 3 available username suggestions,

definition.paragraph: or an empty list if name contains non-ASCII characters or if no valid suggestions could be generated.

note.paragraph: Generated usernames will be combinations of: - firstname + lastname - first initial + lastname - firstname + random number

desc_content.paragraph: Checks if registration api is v1 :param request: :return: Bool
Determine if the given redirect URL/path is safe for redirection.

list_item.paragraph: request_host (str) Originating hostname of the request. This is always considered an acceptable redirect target.
dot_client_id (str|None) ID of Django OAuth Toolkit client. It is acceptable to redirect to any of the DOT clients redirct URIs. This argument is ignored if it is None.
require_https (str) Whether HTTPs should be required in the redirect URL.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns: bool
